Articles.Content:
Announcing KSPRamSaver++.

A forum poster here already did something similar to force OpenGL using an executable file. The problem is, their mod doesn't really go far enough. It stops you from adding extra command-line parameters such as -popupwindow.

This mod has no such limitations.

So without further ado:

THE SAUCE

THE LICENSE (That's MIT by the way)

THE BINARY

THE INSTRUCTIONS (and another copy of the license, just in case)

This will only work for the Windows x64 version of KSP. I tested a 32-bit version and then adjusted it to fire the x64 executable. I do not have Win64 KSP, so in its current shape it is UNTESTED. No warranty implied in whole or in part. If it blows up, kills your kittens or utterly destroys your entire way of life, I am not responsible.

Have fun.

UPDATE

Spotted a bug. Command-line parameters should have a space between them, herpaderp. More than one parameter would have broken. Even if I'm making a jokemod here, I at least want to make a jokemod that works properly.

Edited November 13, 2014 by technicalfool

10/10

Very robust

11/10, will download again.

Extra point given for honesty.
Could you do a similar thing for DX11? Could be handy.

Spotted a bug. Command-line parameters should have a space between them, herpaderp. More than one parameter would have broken. Even if I'm making a jokemod here, I at least want to make a jokemod that works properly.

Please, instead of trying to rebuild the command string, just use _execvp instead of system. (_spawnvp would also be ok, but the difference doesn't especially matter in this case.)

Edited November 13, 2014 by ussbutte
it's like 30x more lines ! Madness !

Why that thread title though?

EDIT: It should be noted that I am in no way a programmer.
